channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: US opens up to fully vaccinated travellers
item.description: The US rolls back international travel restrictions, answering a major demand from allies.

item.title: Canary Islands: Lava from erupting volcano destroys homes
item.description: The volcano on La Palma continues to spew lava after 5,500 were evacuated from villages in its path.

item.title: France's Emmanuel Macron heckled asking Algerian veterans for forgiveness
item.description: The French president is heckled as he promises reparations for Algerians who fought for France.

item.title: Wally the wandering walrus is spotted in Iceland
item.description: The 800kg mammal had not been seen for more than three weeks.

item.title: Barcelona 1-1 Granada: Ronald Araujo rescues point for woeful Barca
item.description: Ronald Araujo's injury-time header rescues a point for Barcelona against Granada, but it does little to paper over the cracks of another poor home display from Ronald Koeman's side.

item.title: Russia election: Putin's party wins election marred by fraud claims
item.description: The pro-Kremlin United Russia wins a parliamentary majority, but loses some ground.

item.title: Jonathan Taylor: Oil whistleblower summoned to Monaco
item.description: Jonathan Taylor faces questioning over bribery and corruption claims despite a failed extradition bid.

item.title: John Challis: Why Serbians have soft spot for late Only Fools actor
item.description: Only Fools and Horses is hugely popular in Serbia, where tributes have been paid to John Challis.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Aukus pact delivers France some hard truths
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield assesses the harsh realities for France after Australia's US-UK deal.

item.title: Brussels to name street after murdered sex worker Eunice Osayande
item.description: The city aims to draw attention to victims of sexual violence after Eunice Osayande's death in 2018.

item.title: Russian elections: How democratic are they?
item.description: Ahead of this week's elections many opposition candidates have been prevented from running.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Lava destroys homes in the Canary Islands
item.description: A volcanic eruption on the Spanish island of La Palma has demolished homes and caused evacuations.

item.title: Russia election: Footage is alleged to show ballot stuffing
item.description: Russia's interior ministry told reporters it had not registered any "significant violations".

item.title: Volcano on Canary Island La Palma erupts, spewing ash and lava into national park
item.description: Video shows the volcano, on La Palma, spewing ash and lava in its first major eruption since 1971.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.
